en: Time to negotiate pay again. You remember how the last negotiation went down and decide to raise your prices - but should you ask for $500 or a safer $300?
Your message disappears into the void. You never hear back from the client and are forced to wonder whether your price threw them off or they died in a freak plane accident.
After a few days, the client grudgingly accepts your offer. You're happy you didn't ask for more. Right now, some work for lower pay is better than none.
